info.description:
Hibernate is a powerful, ultra-high performance object/relational persistence and query service for Java.
This ivy file has been written from what can be found in the README.txt in the lib directory of hibernate distribution.
Known ivy issues:
There is still a problem with xml-apis: the README file does not tell which version to use, and it's really difficult to figure out. If someone knows, send an email. For the moment, you still have to add a dependency on xml apis themselves.
jboss-cache configuration declares a dependency on jboss-cache, but jboss-cache itself is not described as it should be in this ivy repository... so it does not really help to use this configuration.
Note : Build time configuration has not been written

conf.name: standalone
conf.description: configuration to use when outside a j2ee server

conf.name: xmldatabinder
conf.description: use this conf to benefit from xml data binder feature

conf.name: xerces
conf.description: some SAX parser is required, xerces is only an example - beware of trouble with xml apis
for use in j2se 1.3 (which does not provide jdbc 2.0)

conf.name: jca
conf.description: to use optional standard JCA API, if not already in your j2ee container

conf.name: jca-1.3
conf.description: to use optional standard JCA API, if not already in your j2ee container, in a j2se 1.3 sdk

conf.name: c3p0
conf.description: to use optional c3p0 connection pool

conf.name: dbcp
conf.description: to use optional commons-dbcp connection pool

conf.name: proxool
conf.description: to use optional proxool connection pool

conf.name: jboss-cache
conf.description: to use optional jboss-cache - warning: jboss-cache not being described, it is not sufficient for the moment to use this configuration
